## Classes

### <a name="pam_access"></a>`pam_access`

This module manages
* pam_access
* `/etc/security/access.conf`
* Provides ability to inject rules into `/etc/security/access.conf`
See pam_access::entry for more documentation.

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `pam_access` class:

* [`ensure`](#-pam_access--ensure)
* [`manage_pam`](#-pam_access--manage_pam)
* [`entries`](#-pam_access--entries)

##### <a name="-pam_access--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `String`

Determines "what" Puppet will do when managing pam_access. Only valid if
`manage_pam` is True.

If set to `present`, configure pam_access.

If set to `absent`, unconfigure pam_access.

Must be one of "absent" or "present".

##### <a name="-pam_access--manage_pam"></a>`manage_pam`

Data type: `Boolean`

If true, Puppet will do what the `ensure` parameter dictates.
Default: False

##### <a name="-pam_access--entries"></a>`entries`

Data type: `Hash`



Options:

* **Entries**: to add to `/etc/security/access.conf`

See pam_access::entry for more documentation.

### <a name="pam_access--pam"></a>`pam_access::pam`

See README.md for usage information

### <a name="pam_access--pam--debian"></a>`pam_access::pam::debian`

Class: pam_access::pam::debian

Private class - Not to be used directly
See README.md for usage information

### <a name="pam_access--pam--redhat"></a>`pam_access::pam::redhat`

Implement pam_access on RHEL8 systems

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `pam_access::pam::redhat` class:

* [`authselect_features`](#-pam_access--pam--redhat--authselect_features)

##### <a name="-pam_access--pam--redhat--authselect_features"></a>`authselect_features`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Valid only for RHEL8

Default:
* `with-pamaccess`

### <a name="pam_access--pam--redhat7"></a>`pam_access::pam::redhat7`

Configure pam_access on RHEL7 and earlier

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `pam_access::pam::redhat7` class:

* [`enable_pamaccess_flags`](#-pam_access--pam--redhat7--enable_pamaccess_flags)
* [`disable_pamaccess_flags`](#-pam_access--pam--redhat7--disable_pamaccess_flags)

##### <a name="-pam_access--pam--redhat7--enable_pamaccess_flags"></a>`enable_pamaccess_flags`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Valid only for RHEL7 and lower.

Default:
* `--enablelocauthorize`
* `--enablepamaccess`

##### <a name="-pam_access--pam--redhat7--disable_pamaccess_flags"></a>`disable_pamaccess_flags`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Valid only for RHEL7 and lower.
Default:
* `--enablelocauthorize`
* `--disablepamaccess`

### <a name="pam_access--pam--suse"></a>`pam_access::pam::suse`

Implement pam_access on SUSE systems

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `pam_access::pam::suse` class:

* [`authselect_features`](#-pam_access--pam--suse--authselect_features)

##### <a name="-pam_access--pam--suse--authselect_features"></a>`authselect_features`

Data type: `Array[String]`

Valid only for SUSE/SLES

Default:
* `with-pamaccess`

## Defined types

### <a name="pam_access--entry"></a>`pam_access::entry`

Define: pam_access::entry

Parameters:

  $ensure = present (default), absent

    If $ensure is present, an access.conf entry will be created; otherwise, one
    (or more) will be removed.

  $user = username, (groupname), ALL (EXCEPT)

    Supply a valid user/group specification.

  $origin = tty, hostname, domainname, address, ALL, LOCAL

    Supply a valid origin specification.

  $group = true, false (default)

    If $group is true, the user specification $user will be interpreted as
    a group name.

Actions:

  Creates an augeas resource to create or remove

Requires:

  Augeas >= 0.8.0 (access.conf lens is not present in earlier releases)

Sample Usage:

  pam_access::entry {
    "mailman-cron":
      user   => "mailman",
      origin => "cron";
    "root-localonly":
      permission => "-",
      user       => "root",
      origin     => "ALL EXCEPT LOCAL";
    "lusers-revoke-access":
      ensure => absent,
      user   => "lusers",
      group  => true;
  }

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `pam_access::entry` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-pam_access--entry--ensure)
* [`permission`](#-pam_access--entry--permission)
* [`user`](#-pam_access--entry--user)
* [`group`](#-pam_access--entry--group)
* [`origin`](#-pam_access--entry--origin)
* [`position`](#-pam_access--entry--position)

##### <a name="-pam_access--entry--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Any`



Default value: `present`

##### <a name="-pam_access--entry--permission"></a>`permission`

Data type: `Any`



Default value: `'+'`

##### <a name="-pam_access--entry--user"></a>`user`

Data type: `Any`



Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-pam_access--entry--group"></a>`group`

Data type: `Any`



Default value: `false`

##### <a name="-pam_access--entry--origin"></a>`origin`

Data type: `Any`



Default value: `'LOCAL'`

##### <a name="-pam_access--entry--position"></a>`position`

Data type: `Any`



Default value: `undef`
